alert.note: Alert for Grant (Wisconsin) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS LaCrosse (Southwestern Wisconsin, Southeastern Minnesota, and Northeast Iowa)
info.headline: Excessive Heat Watch issued August 20 at 5:47PM CDT until August 24 at 8:00PM CDT by NWS LaCrosse
info.description: ...EXCESSIVE HEAT WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM TUESDAY MORNING THROUGH THURSDAY EVENING... ...HEAT ADVISORY WILL EXPIRE AT 6 PM CDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Dangerously hot conditions with heat index of 105 to 110, Tuesday through Thursday afternoons, possibly locally higher at times. * WHERE...In Iowa, Clayton County. In Wisconsin, Grant County. * WHEN...For the Heat Advisory, until 6 PM CDT this evening. For the Excessive Heat Watch, from Tuesday morning through Thursday evening. * IMPACTS...Extreme heat and humidity will significantly increase the potential for heat related illnesses, particularly for those working or participating in outdoor activities. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Highest confidence in extreme heat and humidity is on Tuesday and Wednesday. A front moving through during the day on Thursday which could result in slightly lower afternoon heat indices.
info.instruction: Monitor the latest forecasts and warnings for updates on this situation. Be prepared to drink plenty of fluids, stay in an air- conditioned room, stay out of the sun, and check up on relatives and neighbors. Young children and pets should never be left unattended in vehicles under any circumstances. This is especially true during warm or hot weather when car interiors can reach lethal temperatures in a matter of minutes.
